description: This notification is generated when a
mplsManTunnelOperStatus object for one of the
configured tunnels is about to leave the down state
and transition into some other state (but not into
the notPresent state). This other state is
indicated by the included value of
mplsManTunnelOperStatus.
This structure is the same as the generic
AMB_MPLS_TUNNEL_TRAP_COMMON.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsManTunnelUp PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsManTunnelAdminStatus i 1 PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsManTunnelOperStatus i 1 PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsManTunnelName s EXAMPLE

description: Indicates the desired operational status of this
tunnel.
variables.name: PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsManTunnelAdminStatus

description: Indicates the actual operational status of this
tunnel, which is typically but not limited to, a
function of the state of individual segments of
this tunnel.
variables.name: PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsManTunnelOperStatus

description: The canonical name assigned to the tunnel. This name
can be used to refer to the tunnel on the LSRs
console port. Also see the description of ifName
in RFC 2863.
variables.name: PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsManTunnelName

description: This notification is generated when a
mplsManTunnelOperStatus object for one of the
configured tunnels is about to enter the down state
from some other state (but not from the notPresent
state). This other state is indicated by the
included value of mplsManTunnelOperStatus.
This structure is the same as the generic
AMB_MPLS_TUNNEL_TRAP_COMMON.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsManTunnelDown PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsManTunnelAdminStatus i 1 PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsManTunnelOperStatus i 1 PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsManTunnelName s EXAMPLE

description: Indicates the desired operational status of this
tunnel.
variables.name: PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsManTunnelAdminStatus

description: Indicates the actual operational status of this
tunnel, which is typically but not limited to, a
function of the state of individual segments of
this tunnel.
variables.name: PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsManTunnelOperStatus

description: The canonical name assigned to the tunnel. This name
can be used to refer to the tunnel on the LSRs
console port. Also see the description of ifName
in RFC 2863.
variables.name: PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsManTunnelName

description: This notification is generated when a
mplsAutoTunnelOperStatus object for one of the
configured tunnels is about to leave the down state
and transition into some other state (but not into
the notPresent state). This other state is
indicated by the included value of
mplsAutoTunnelOperStatus.
This structure is the same as the generic
AMB_MPLS_TUNNEL_TRAP_COMMON.
See similar object in mplsManTunnelTable.
variables.name: PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsAutoTunnelOperStatus

description: See similar object in mplsManTunnelTable.
variables.name: PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsAutoTunnelName

description: This notification is generated when a
mplsAutoTunnelOperStatus object for one of the
configured tunnels is about to enter the down state
from some other state (but not from the notPresent
state). This other state is indicated by the
included value of mplsAutoTunnelOperStatus.
This structure is the same as the generic
AMB_MPLS_TUNNEL_TRAP_COMMON.
See similar object in mplsManTunnelTable.
variables.name: PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsAutoTunnelOperStatus

description: See similar object in mplsManTunnelTable.
variables.name: PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsAutoTunnelName

description: This notification is generated when a
mplsDynTunnelOperStatus object for one of the
configured tunnels is about to leave the down state
and transition into some other state (but not into
the notPresent state). This other state is
indicated by the included value of
mplsDynTunnelOperStatus.
This structure is the same as the generic
AMB_MPLS_TUNNEL_TRAP_COMMON.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsDynTunnelUp PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsDynTunnelAdminStatus i 1 PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsDynTunnelOperStatus i 1 PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsDynTunnelName s EXAMPLE

description: See similar object in mplsManTunnelTable.
variables.name: PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsDynTunnelAdminStatus

description: See similar object in mplsManTunnelTable.
variables.name: PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsDynTunnelOperStatus

description: See similar object in mplsManTunnelTable.
variables.name: PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsDynTunnelName

description: This notification is generated when a
mplsDynTunnelOperStatus object for one of the
configured tunnels is about to enter the down state
from some other state (but not from the notPresent
state). This other state is indicated by the
included value of mplsDynTunnelOperStatus.
This structure is the same as the generic
AMB_MPLS_TUNNEL_TRAP_COMMON.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsDynTunnelDown PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsDynTunnelAdminStatus i 1 PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsDynTunnelOperStatus i 1 PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsDynTunnelName s EXAMPLE

description: See similar object in mplsManTunnelTable.
variables.name: PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsDynTunnelAdminStatus

description: See similar object in mplsManTunnelTable.
variables.name: PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsDynTunnelOperStatus

description: See similar object in mplsManTunnelTable.
variables.name: PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsDynTunnelName

description: This notification is generated when a tunnel is
reoptimized. If the mplsTunnelARHopTable is used
then this tunnel instance's entry in the
mplsTunnelARHopTable MAY contain the new path for
this tunnel some time after this trap is issued by
the agent.
This structure is the same as the generic
AMB_MPLS_TUNNEL_TRAP_COMMON.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsManTunnelReoptimized PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsManTunnelAdminStatus i 1 PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsManTunnelOperStatus i 1 PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsManTunnelARHopTableIndex u 9999 PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsManTunnelName s EXAMPLE

description: Indicates the desired operational status of this
tunnel.
variables.name: PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsManTunnelAdminStatus

description: Indicates the actual operational status of this
tunnel, which is typically but not limited to, a
function of the state of individual segments of
this tunnel.
variables.name: PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsManTunnelOperStatus

description: Index into the mplsTunnelARHopTable entry that
specifies the actual hops traversed by the tunnel.
This is automatically updated by the agent when the
actual hops becomes available.
variables.name: PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsManTunnelARHopTableIndex

description: The canonical name assigned to the tunnel. This name
can be used to refer to the tunnel on the LSRs
console port. Also see the description of ifName
in RFC 2863.
variables.name: PRVT-MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsManTunnelName
